column1: '''Sunday''' (archaic form ''Sunnendei'') was the second day of the week in the [[Shire Calendar]]. It was dedicated to the [[Sun]]
After the reform of [[Isengrim Took II]]
column2: <ref name=cal/> [[1 January]] and [[1 July]] always fell on Sunday.
a word preserved in the [[Yellowskin]]. It is dedicated to the [[Sun]].<ref name=cal/>

column1: ''Sunday'' is translated as "Sunday" in ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' but it was not the chief day of the Hobbitish week
column2: that being Friday. For this reason there was one exception
column3: and the "Sunday" referred in the poem ''[[The Man in the Moon Stayed Up Too Late]]''
column4: actually refers to the Hobbitish [[Highday|Friday]].<ref name=cal/><ref>{{FR|Sign}}</ref>
